subSubSection.paragraph: Japan, Taiwan, Korea, China, Philippines, and Vietnam.

Japanese researchers have considered that the Rhinogobius brunneus complex currently includes many valid, synonymous species,and potentially several undescribed species ( Akihito et al. 2002 , Akihito et al. 2013 ). This taxon of this region matches the " Rhinogobius sp. OR of Akihito et al. (2002) " species complex (see Akihito et al. 2002 , Akihito et al. 2013 ). It was recorded only from lentic waters including irrigation ponds, channels, and slow moving parts of rivers in the present study.
